h6301.definition: from {{h6299}} and {{h6697}}; a rock (i.e. God) has ransomed; Pedahtsur, an Israelite; Pedahzur.

h6302.definition: passive participle of {{h6299}}. ransomed (and so occurring under {{h6299}}); as abstractly (in plural masculine) a ransom; (that are) to be (that were) redeemed.

h6303.definition: from {{h6299}}; ransom; Padon, one of the Nethinim.; Padon.

h6304.definition: or פְּדֻת; from {{h6929}}; distinction; also deliverance; division, redeem, redemption.

h6305.definition: or פְּדָיָהוּ; from {{h6299}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has ransomed; Pedajah, the name of six Israelites; Pedaiah.

h6306.definition: or פִּדְיֹם; also פִּדְיוֹן; or פִּדְיֹן; from {{h6299}}; a ransom; ransom, that were redeemed, redemption.

h6307.definition: from an unused root meaning to extend; a plateau; or פַּדַּן אֲרָם; from the same and {{h758}}; the table-land of Aram; Paddan or Paddan-Aram, a region of Syria; Padan, Padan-aram.

h6308.definition: a primitive root; to retrieve; deliver.

h6309.definition: from an unused root meaning to be greasy; suet; fat.

h6310.definition: from {{h6284}}; the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to; accord(-ing as, -ing to), after, appointment, assent, collar, command(-ment), × eat, edge, end, entry,   file, hole, × in, mind, mouth, part, portion, × (should) say(-ing), sentence, skirt, sound, speech, × spoken, talk, tenor, × to,   two-edged, wish, word.

h6311.definition: or פֹּא; (Job 38:11), or פּוֹ; probably from a primitive inseparable particle 'p' (of demonstrative force) and {{h1931}}; this place (French ici), i.e. here or hence; here, hither, the one (other, this, that) side.

h6312.definition: or פֻּוָּה; from {{h6284}}; a blast; Puah or Puvvah, the name of two Israelites; Phuvah, Pua, Puah.

h6313.definition: a primitive root; to be sluggish; cease, be feeble, faint, be slacked.

h6315.definition: a primitive root; to puff, i.e. blow with the breath or air; hence, to fan (as a breeze), to utter, to kindle (a fire), to scoff; blow (upon), break, puff, bring into a snare, speak, utter.

h6316.definition: of foreign origin; Put, a son of Ham, also the name of his descendants or their region, and of a Persian tribe; Phut, Put.

h6317.definition: from an unused root (probably meaning to disparage) and {{h410}}; contempt of God; Putiel, an Israelite; Putiel.

h6318.definition: of Egyptian derivation; Potiphar, an Egyptian; Potiphar.

h6319.definition: of Egyptian derivation; Poti-Phera, an Egyptian; Poti-pherah.

h6320.definition: from an unused root meaning to paint; dye (specifically, stibium for the eyes); fair colours, glistering, paint(-ed) (-ing).

h6321.definition: from an unused root meaning to be thick; a bean (as plump); beans.

h6322.definition: of foreign origin; Pul, the name of an Assyrian king and of an Ethiopian tribe; Pul.

h6323.definition: a primitive root; meaning to turn, i.e. be perplexed; be distracted.

h6324.definition: patronymically from an unused name meaning a turn; a Punite (collectively) or descendants of an unknown Pun; Punites.

h6325.definition: from {{h6323}}; perplexity; Punon, a place in the Desert; Punon.

h6326.definition: from an unused root meaning to glitter; brilliancy; Puah, an Israelitess; Puah.

h6327.definition: a primitive root; to dash in pieces, literally or figuratively (especially to disperse); break (dash, shake) in (to) pieces, cast (abroad), disperse (selves), drive, retire, scatter (abroad), spread abroad.

h6328.definition: a primitive root; to waver; stumble, move.

h6329.definition: a primitive root [rather identical with {{h6328}} through the idea of dropping out; compare {{h5312}}]; to issue, i.e. furnish; causatively, to secure; figuratively, to succeed; afford, draw out, further, get, obtain.

h6331.definition: a primitive root; to crush; break, bring to nought, × utterly take.

h6332.definition: also (plural) פּוּרִים; or פֻּרִים; from {{h6331}}; a lot (as by means of a broken piece); Pur, Purim.

h6333.definition: from {{h6331}}; a wine-press (as crushing the grapes); winepress.

h6334.definition: of Persian origin; Poratha, a son of Haman; Poratha.

h6335.definition: a primitive root; to spread; figuratively, act proudly; grow up, be grown fat, spread selves, be scattered.

h6336.definition: patronymically from an unused name meaning a hinge; a Puthite (collectively) or descendants of an unknown Puth; Puhites (as if from {{h6312}}).

h6337.definition: from {{h6338}}; pure (gold); hence, gold itself (as refined); fine (pure) gold.

h6338.definition: a primitive root; to refine (gold); best (gold).

h6339.definition: a primitive root (identical with {{h6338}}); to solidify (as if by refining); also to spring (as if separating the limbs); leap, be made strong.

h6340.definition: a primitive root; to scatter, whether in enmity or bounty; disperse, scatter (abroad).

h6341.definition: from {{h6351}}; a (metallic) sheet (as pounded thin); also a spring net (as spread out like a lamina); gin, (thin) plate, snare.

h6342.definition: a primitive root; to be startled (by a sudden alarm); hence, to fear in general; be afraid, stand in awe, (be in) fear, make to shake.

h6343.definition: from {{h6342}}; a (sudden) alarm (properly, the object feared, by implication, the feeling); dread(-ful), fear, (thing) great (fear, -ly feared), terror.

h6344.definition: the same as {{h6343}}; a testicle (as a cause of shame akin to fear); stone.

h6346.definition: of foreign origin; a prefect (of a city or small district); captain, deputy, governor.

h6348.definition: a primitive root; to bubble up or froth (as boiling water), i.e. (figuratively) to be unimportant; light.

h6349.definition: from {{h6348}}; ebullition, i.e. froth (figuratively, lust); unstable.

h6351.definition: a primitive root; to batter out; but used only as denominative from {{h6341}},; to spread a net; be snared.

h6352.definition: perhaps from an unused root probably meaning to be black; a coal, whether charred or live; coals.

h6353.definition: (Aramaic) from an unused root probably meaning to fashion; a potter; potter.

h6354.definition: probably from an unused root apparently meaning to dig; a pit, especially for catching animals; hole, pit, snare.

h6355.definition: from {{h6354}} and {{h4124}}; pit of Moab; Pachath-Moab, an Israelite; Pahathmoab.

h6356.definition: from the same as {{h6354}}; a hole (by mildew in a garment); fret inward.

h6357.definition: of foreign derivation; a gem, probably the topaz; topaz.

h6358.definition: passive participle of {{h6362}}; opened, i.e. (as noun) a bud; open.

h6360.definition: intensively from an unused root meaning to pound; a hammer; hammer.

h6361.definition: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to that of {{h6360}}; a gown (as if hammered out wide); hose.

h6362.definition: a primitive root; to cleave or burst through, i.e. (causatively) to emit, whether literal or figurative (gape); dismiss, free, let (shoot) out, slip away.

h6363.definition: or פִּטְרָה; from {{h6362}}; a fissure, i.e. (concretely) firstling (as opening the matrix); firstling, openeth, such as open.

h6364.definition: of Egyptian origin; Pi-Beseth, a place in Egypt; Pi-beseth.

h6365.definition: from an unused root probably meaning to pierce; (figuratively) misfortune; destruction, ruin.

h6366.definition: or פִּיָּה; feminine of {{h6310}}; an edge; (two-) edge(-d).

h6367.definition: from {{h6310}} and the feminine plural of a noun (from the same root as {{h2356}}), with the article interpolated; mouth of the gorges; Pi-ha-Chiroth, a place in Egypt; Pi-hahiroth. (In Numbers 14:19 without Pi-.)

h6368.definition: from {{h6315}}; a powder (as easily puffed away), i.e. ashes or dust; ashes.

h6369.definition: apparently from {{h6310}} and {{h3605}}; mouth of all; Picol, a Philistine; Phichol.

h6370.definition: or פִּלֶגֶשׁ; of uncertain derivation; a concubine; also (masculine) a paramour; concubine, paramour.

h6371.definition: probably from an unused root meaning to be plump; obesity; collops.

h6372.definition: apparently from {{h6310}} and a variation of {{h5175}}; mouth of a serpent; Pinechas, the name of three Israelites; Phinehas.

h6373.definition: probably the same as {{h6325}}; Pinon, an Idumaean; Pinon.

h6374.definition: for {{h6366}}; an edge or tooth; tooth, × two-edged.

h6376.definition: from {{h6335}}; dispersive; Pishon, a river of Eden; Pison.

h6377.definition: probably from the same as {{h6596}}; expansive; Pithon, an Israelite; Pithon.

h6378.definition: from {{h6379}}; a flask (from which a liquid may flow); box, vial.

h6379.definition: a primitive root; to pour; run out.

h6380.definition: from the active participle (of the same form as the first word) feminine of an unused root (meaning to entrap) and plural of {{h6643}}; trap of gazelles; Pokereth-Tsebajim, one of the 'servants of Solomon'; Pochereth of Zebaim.

h6381.definition: a primitive root; properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful; accomplish, (arise...too, be too) hard, hidden, things too high, (be, do, do a, shew) marvelous(-ly, -els, things, work), miracles, perform, separate, make singular, (be, great, make) wonderful(-ers, -ly, things, works), wondrous (things, works, -ly).

h6382.definition: from {{h6381}}; a miracle; marvellous thing, wonder(-ful, -fully).

h6383.definition: or פָּלִיא; from {{h6381}}; remarkable; secret, wonderful.

h6384.definition: patronymically from {{h6396}}; a Palluite (collectively) or descendants of Pallu; Palluites.

h6385.definition: a primitive root; to split (literally or figuratively); divide.

h6388.definition: from {{h6385}}; a rill (i.e. small channel of water, as in irrigation); river, stream.

h6389.definition: the same as {{h6388}}; earthquake; Peleg, a son of Shem; Peleg.

h6390.definition: from {{h6385}}; a runlet, i.e. gully; division, river.

h6393.definition: from an unused root meaning to divide; a cleaver, i.e. iron armature (of a chariot); torch.

h6394.definition: of uncertain derivation; Pildash, a relative of Abraham; Pildash.

h6395.definition: a primitive root; to distinguish (literally or figuratively); put a difference, show marvellous, separate, set apart, sever, make wonderfully.

h6396.definition: from {{h6395}}; distinguished; Pallu, an Israelite; Pallu, Phallu.

h6397.definition: patronymically from an unused name (from {{h6395}}) meaning separate; a Pelonite or inhabitant of an unknown Palon; Pelonite.

h6398.definition: a primitive root; to slice, i.e. break open or pierce; bring forth, cleave, cut, shred, strike through.

h6399.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6398}}; to serve or worship; minister, serve.
